head: How do we know the votes count? The PVT has verified election results in Nigeria since 2011.
sub: [graphic of the results verification graphs from 2011 and 2015]
[BBC-style video of Cynthia explaining the PVT, including: What it is. History in Nigeria. How it’s different from other methodologies. Findings in 2011 and 2015]

head: PVT is the world’s most sophisticated election observation methodology. It uses statistics and information and communication technologies (ICTs) to verify election results.
sub: [motion graphic of phones and illustrative bar graphs]
text: Unlike other election observations, a strategic sample determines where PVT observers observe.

head: PVT has been used in elections throughout Africa - including Burkina Faso, Côte d’Ivoire, Ghana, Kenya, Malawi, Tunisia, Uganda, Zambia and Zimbabwe - to make sure that votes are properly counted. It has been an important part of Nigerian elections since 2011.
Ordinary Nigerians will leverage the power of the PVT to make sure the votes count in 2019!
